data.title: Swoopna Suman

data.text:
Swoopna Suman, born on December 2, 1995, in Kathmandu, Nepal, is a talented Nepali singer, songwriter, and guitarist. His unique blend of contemporary and traditional Nepali music has garnered him a massive fanbase both in Nepal and abroad.

Swoopna Suman embarked on his musical journey in 2012, initially gaining attention by posting home videos on YouTube. His talent caught the eye of Karma Records, leading to the release of his first official song, “K Saro Ramri Bhako,” in 2014. Since then, he has continued to create original music, including tracks like “Kunai Din,” “Kasari Bhanu,” “Ma Timro,” and “Kurera Baschu”.

In 2023, Swoopna Suman gained even more popularity with the release of his song “Je Chhau Timi” in collaboration with Samir Shrestha. His musical journey has been marked by a fusion of passion, love for music, and a desire to reinvent himself.

Career and Artistry: Swoopna aspires to perform at notable venues worldwide alongside his band, The Asters. The band includes talented musicians such as Ayush Bahadur Shrestha (Keyboards), Saroj Ghimire Chhetri (Drums), Alish KC (Bass), Asim Tamang (Lead Guitar), and Abhishek Pun (Audio). The Asters formed in 2021 and have been playing alongside Swoopna ever since.

Here’s a glimpse of Swoopna Suman’s discography:

2015: “K Saro Ramri Vako”

2018: “Jane Kura Nagara,” “Yaadma Raknechhu”

2019: “Timro Aankha”

2020: “Farki Herda,” “Thanai Vayana,” “Juneli Raatma”

2021: “Mayalu,” “Najeekidai,” “Kaha Ma Jaau”

2022: “Kasari Bhanu,” “Ma Timro,” “Baacha Vayo”

2023: “Je Chhau Timi,” “Upahaar”
